data.tweet: See the numbers behind Liverpool's draw with Everton ⚽️ 🧵 👇
sentences: Liverpool drew 0 - 0 with Everton.

data.tweet: Despite not finding a goal, Liverpool took nine shots on target, compared with four from Everton. Liverpool also managed to create an impressive 2.4 xG, while Premier League teams have averaged 1.3 xG and 4.1 shots on target per match this season.
sentences: Liverpool managed to create an impressive 2.4 xG worth of chances.
Premier League teams have averaged 1.3 expected goals per 90 minutes.
Liverpool took nine shots on target.
Everton took four shots on target.
Premier League teams have averaged 4.1 shots on target per 90 minutes.

data.tweet: Liverpool dominated possession, completing 414 passes to Everton's 242.
sentences: Liverpool completed 414 passes.
Everton completed 242 passes.

data.tweet: Liverpool were aggressive out of possession, making six tackles in the final third, while Everton attempted just one. In their last game (against Newcastle) Liverpool didn't attempt a single tackle in the attacking third, while throughout the season they've averaged 2.8 per 90 minutes.
sentences: Liverpool attempted to make six challenges in the final third.
Everton attempted to make one challenges in the final third.
In their last game (against Newcastle Utd) Liverpool attempted to make zero challenges in the final third.
This season, Liverpool have averaged 2.8 attempted challenges in the final third per 90 minutes.
Premier League teams attempted to make 2.4 challenges in the final third per 90 minutes.

data.tweet: Liverpool completed 94 long balls, while Everton managed 45. The Reds made a staggering 3,110 yards worth of progressive passes, while Everton successfully passed the ball 1,713 yards towards the Liverpool goal.
sentences: Liverpool completed 94 long balls.
Everton completed 45 long balls.
Liverpool passed the ball a total of 3110 yards towards the opponent's goal.
Everton passed the ball a total of 1713 yards towards the opponent's goal.

data.tweet: Liverpool succesffuly played an impressive 44 passes into the final third, while Everton managed 16. However Liverpool only completed six successful dribbles, down from 16 in the previous match (against Newcastle).
sentences: Liverpool managed to play an impressive 44 successful balls into the final third.
Everton managed to play an impressive 16 successful balls into the final third.
Liverpool dribbled past an opponent six times.
In their last game (against Newcastle Utd) Liverpool dribbled past Newcastle Utd 16 times.
story: Successful dribbles (in last match v Newcastle Utd)

data.tweet: Virgil van Dijk was our man of the match. He successfuly completed 71 passes out of 78 (more than any other player on the pitch), while Joe Gomez completed 68.

data.tweet: This season, Virgil van Dijk has made 3,352 yards worth of progressive passes. That's more than any other player in the Premier League except his teammate Trent Alexander-Arnold who has totalled 3,790 yards worth of progressive passes.
